main-subtitle: Tools to foster simultaneous participation in the classroom.
instructions-body: To start an activity as a presenter, open the application you want to use and click on the link at the bottom of the screen.
app-vota-desc: Create multiple-choice polls. Participants join with a code and vote from their devices, viewing results in bar charts that update instantly.
app-nube-desc: Gather ideas and display them as a dynamic cloud. You can download the cloud as a PNG image or the data in a spreadsheet (CSV).
app-ideas-desc: A two-phase tool: first, participants anonymously propose ideas. Then, everyone votes on the proposals to prioritize the most popular ones.
app-muro-desc: Allows participants to send virtual "post-its". The content is not persistent, but you can export the wall to PDF or the data to a spreadsheet (CSV).
app-escala-desc: Create Likert-type, numeric, or traffic light scales to gather opinions quickly and visually. Ideal for ratings or measuring understanding.
app-qplay-desc: A tool to gamify the classroom. The teacher loads a questionnaire and the students compete in real time from their devices to lead the ranking.
app-boardlive-desc: Real-time collaborative whiteboard. The host creates the session, shares a code or QR, and controls who can draw. Includes pages, drawing tools, image insertion, and PDF export. It also lets teachers project on the classroom digital whiteboard what they write or draw on their tablet in real time.
